trans-unit.source: dotnet-restore
trans-unit.target: dotnet-restore

trans-unit.source: dotnet-restore
trans-unit.target: dotnet-restore

trans-unit.source: .NET, .NET Core
trans-unit.target: .NET, .NET Core

trans-unit.source: dotnet-restore
trans-unit.target: dotnet-restore

trans-unit.source: NAME
trans-unit.target: NAME

trans-unit.source: - Restores the dependencies and tools of a project
trans-unit.target: - Restores the dependencies and tools of a project

trans-unit.source: SYNOPSIS
trans-unit.target: SYNOPSIS

trans-unit.source: DESCRIPTION
trans-unit.target: DESCRIPTION

trans-unit.source: The `dotnet restore` command uses NuGet to restore dependencies as well as project-specific tools that are specified in the project.json file.
trans-unit.target: The `dotnet restore` command uses NuGet to restore dependencies as well as project-specific tools that are specified in the project.json file.

trans-unit.source: By default, the restoration of dependencies and tools are done in parallel.
trans-unit.target: By default, the restoration of dependencies and tools are done in parallel.

trans-unit.source: In order to restore the dependencies, NuGet needs the feeds where the packages are located.
trans-unit.target: In order to restore the dependencies, NuGet needs the feeds where the packages are located.

trans-unit.source: Feeds are usually provided via the NuGet.config configuration file; a default one is present when the CLI tools are installed.
trans-unit.target: Feeds are usually provided via the NuGet.config configuration file; a default one is present when the CLI tools are installed.

trans-unit.source: You can specify more feeds by creating your own NuGet.config file in the project directory.
trans-unit.target: You can specify more feeds by creating your own NuGet.config file in the project directory.

trans-unit.source: Feeds can also be specified per invocation on the command line.
trans-unit.target: Feeds can also be specified per invocation on the command line.

trans-unit.source: For dependencies, you can specify where the restored packages are placed during the restore operation using the `--packages` argument.
trans-unit.target: For dependencies, you can specify where the restored packages are placed during the restore operation using the `--packages` argument.

trans-unit.source: If not specified, the default NuGet package cache is used.
trans-unit.target: If not specified, the default NuGet package cache is used.

trans-unit.source: It is found in the `.nuget/packages` directory in the user's home directory on all operating systems (for example, `/home/user1` on Linux or `C:\Users\user1` on Windows).
trans-unit.target: It is found in the `.nuget/packages` directory in the user's home directory on all operating systems (for example, `/home/user1` on Linux or `C:\Users\user1` on Windows).

trans-unit.source: For project-specific tooling, `dotnet restore` first restores the package in which the tool is packed, and then proceeds to restore the tool's dependencies as specified in its project.json.
trans-unit.target: For project-specific tooling, `dotnet restore` first restores the package in which the tool is packed, and then proceeds to restore the tool's dependencies as specified in its project.json.

trans-unit.source: OPTIONS
trans-unit.target: OPTIONS

trans-unit.source: A list of projects or project folders to restore.
trans-unit.target: A list of projects or project folders to restore.

trans-unit.source: The list can contain either a path to a `project.json` file, or a path to `global.json` file or folder.
trans-unit.target: The list can contain either a path to a `project.json` file, or a path to `global.json` file or folder.

trans-unit.source: The restore operation runs recursively for all subdirectories and restores for each given project.json file it finds.
trans-unit.target: The restore operation runs recursively for all subdirectories and restores for each given project.json file it finds.

trans-unit.source: , `--source` [SOURCE]
trans-unit.target: , `--source` [SOURCE]

trans-unit.source: Specifies a source to use during the restore operation.
trans-unit.target: Specifies a source to use during the restore operation.

trans-unit.source: This overrides all of the sources specified in the NuGet.config file(s).
trans-unit.target: This overrides all of the sources specified in the NuGet.config file(s).

trans-unit.source: Multiple sources can be provided by specifying this option multiple times.
trans-unit.target: Multiple sources can be provided by specifying this option multiple times.

trans-unit.source: [DIR]
trans-unit.target: [DIR]

trans-unit.source: Specifies the directory to place the restored packages in.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the directory to place the restored packages in.

trans-unit.source: Disables restoring multiple projects in parallel.
trans-unit.target: Disables restoring multiple projects in parallel.

trans-unit.source: , `--fallbacksource` [FEED]
trans-unit.target: , `--fallbacksource` [FEED]

trans-unit.source: Specifies a fallback source that will be used in the restore operation if all other sources fail.
trans-unit.target: Specifies a fallback source that will be used in the restore operation if all other sources fail.

trans-unit.source: All valid feed formats are allowed.
trans-unit.target: All valid feed formats are allowed.

trans-unit.source: Multiple fallback sources can be provided by specifying this option multiple times.
trans-unit.target: Multiple fallback sources can be provided by specifying this option multiple times.

trans-unit.source: [FILE]
trans-unit.target: [FILE]

trans-unit.source: Configuration file (NuGet.config) to use for the restore operation.
trans-unit.target: Configuration file (NuGet.config) to use for the restore operation.

trans-unit.source: [LEVEL]
trans-unit.target: [LEVEL]

trans-unit.source: The verbosity of logging to use.
trans-unit.target: The verbosity of logging to use.

trans-unit.source: Allowed values: Debug, Verbose, Information, Minimal, Warning, or Error.
trans-unit.target: Allowed values: Debug, Verbose, Information, Minimal, Warning, or Error.

trans-unit.source: EXAMPLES
trans-unit.target: EXAMPLES

trans-unit.source: Restores dependencies and tools for the project in the current directory.
trans-unit.target: Restores dependencies and tools for the project in the current directory.

trans-unit.source: Restores dependencies and tools for the `app1` project found in the given path.
trans-unit.target: Restores dependencies and tools for the `app1` project found in the given path.

trans-unit.source: Restores the dependencies and tools for the project in the current directory using the file path provided as the fallback source.
trans-unit.target: Restores the dependencies and tools for the project in the current directory using the file path provided as the fallback source.

trans-unit.source: Restores the dependencies and tools for the project in the current directory using the two file paths provided as the fallback sources.
trans-unit.target: Restores the dependencies and tools for the project in the current directory using the two file paths provided as the fallback sources.

trans-unit.source: Restores dependencies and tools for the project in the current directory and shows only errors in the output.
trans-unit.target: Restores dependencies and tools for the project in the current directory and shows only errors in the output.
